channel.title: Random picks [317]
channel.description:
Hey there im just wondering if you could give me the code for a random pick Example:
When i click this Object XXXX it will give me a pick that is common but if im lucky i got a 25% chance that i will get a rare pick that item id is ZZZZ
I just need the code and some explanation of it
Thnx - Bigballers

item.title: Random picks [317]
item.dc:creator: @bigballers bigballers
item.description:
@bigballers wrote:

[quote author=r0ckstar96 link=topic=390022.msg2912367#msg2912367 date=1250183594]

[quote=“Chassy13, post:4, topic:294929”]Use an array, then an if-statement to add the item.

[code] public static int items[] = {id, id, id, id, id};

public static int items() {
    return items[(int) (Math.random() * items.length)];
}[/code]

addItem(items(), 1);

It really won’t give you an exact percentage, but if you do something like this:

public static int items[] = {1, 1, 1, 2};

I guess that is pretty much the same as a 25% chance of getting 2.[/quote]

And you said you weren’t that good of a programmer

Too much Delta

I’m really not that great of a programmer, :P.

Lol? Spam much[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 13, 2009, 11:21:13 am[/size][hr]now all i need is barrows chest id

Read full topic

item.title: Random picks [317]
item.dc:creator: @bigballers bigballers
item.description:
@bigballers wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:4, topic:294929”]Use an array, then an if-statement to add the item.

[code] public static int items[] = {id, id, id, id, id};

public static int items() {
    return items[(int) (Math.random() * items.length)];
}[/code]

addItem(items(), 1);

It really won’t give you an exact percentage, but if you do something like this:

public static int items[] = {1, 1, 1, 2};

I guess that is pretty much the same as a 25% chance of getting 2.[/quote]
Well i did that except i spammed the array

public static int barrows[] = {4740, 4740, 4740, 4740, 4740, 4740, 4740, 4740, 4740, 4740, 4740, 4740, 4740, 4740, 4740, 4740, 4740, 4740, 4740, 4740, 4740, 4740, 4740, 4740, 4716, 4718, 4720, 4722, 4724, 4726, 4728, 4730, 4732, 4734, 4736, 4738, 4745, 4747, 4749, 4751, 4753, 4755, 4757, 4759, 4740, 4740, 4740, 4740, 4740, 4740};[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 13, 2009, 11:08:17 am[/size][hr]so there is a 2% chance of each barrows item…

item.title: Random picks [317]
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Use an array, then an if-statement to add the item.

[code] public static int items[] = {id, id, id, id, id};

public static int items() {
    return items[(int) (Math.random() * items.length)];
}[/code]

addItem(items(), 1);

It really won’t give you an exact percentage, but if you do something like this:

public static int items[] = {1, 1, 1, 2};

I guess that is pretty much the same as a 25% chance of getting 2.
